DOC.criteria: Meets diagnosis gout accord American Rheumatism Association ( ARA ) Criteria Classification Acute Arthritis Primary Gout . Not urate lower therapy ( ULT ) must sUA level ≥ 8.0 mg/dL screening . If concomitant ULT must sUA level ≥ 6.5 mg/dL screening . Must least 2 gout flare past year . Consumption 14 drink alcohol per week ( eg , 1 drink = 5 oz [ 150 mL ] wine , 12 oz [ 360 mL ] beer , 1.5 oz [ 45 mL ] hard liquor ) . History suspicion drug abuse . History autoimmune disease require systemic treatment . Known suspected human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) , hepatitis C antibody ( HCV ) , hepatitis B antibody ( HBsAg ) infection . History malignancy within previous 5 year ( exception nonmelanoma skin cancer treat evidence recurrence , treat cervical dysplasia treat situ Grade 1 cervical cancer ) . Myocardial infarction , unstable angina , New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class III IV heart failure , stroke within last 12 month . Uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic pressure 160 mm Hg diastolic pressure 95 mm Hg ) . Estimated creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min CockcroftGault formula . Kidney organ transplant . Active peptic ulcer disease require treatment . History xanthinuria , active liver disease , hepatic dysfunction . If unable take gout flare prophylaxis either colchicine nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) due contraindication ( e.g . toxicity , renal function , use contraindicate medication ) . Known hypersensitivity allergy allopurinol .
